newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian air force plane crashes, 22 feared killed.
newsitem.headline: Indian air force plane crashes, 22 feared killed.

text.p: An Indian Air Force (IAF) aircraft crashed near a village in the southern Indian state of Andhra Pradesh on Tuesday, and all 22 people on board were feared killed, police said.

The British-made Avro aircraft crashed in a field in Peddareddypalem near Nellore town after taking off from Madras, the capital of the neighbouring state of Tamil Nadu, the Press Trust of India (PTI) said.
Nellore is 150 km (90 miles) north of Madras.
The aircraft was bound for Hyderabad, the state capital of Andhra Pradesh, PTI said.
The news agency said mangled bodies and military equipment were strewn around the site of the crash.
A police official in Hyderabad told Reuters the aircraft had taken off from the air force base in Madras at about 3.30 p.m. (1000 GMT).
PTI said one of the airplane's engines failed and the pilot reported the problem to air traffic control (ATC) authorities in Madras. The aircraft then hit a hill and crashed into a field.

"We started worrying about its fate when the pilot did not come into contact with the air traffic control here. Later, we got a message from the Madras ATC about the tragedy," PTI quoted Asha Ram, Hyderabad's airport director, as saying.
